title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
vibeBlurb: Champagne-soaked summer nights that taste bittersweet. A green light across the water, always just out of reach. The ache of wanting something so badly it destroys you.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
vibeBlurb: Quiet afternoons and unspoken feelings. Two people orbiting each other through years, always connected by invisible threads. The exquisite pain of knowing someone completely.

title: The Secret History
author: Donna Tartt
vibeBlurb: Ivy-covered walls hiding terrible secrets. The intoxicating pull of beauty and knowledge taken too far. Ancient Greek texts and modern guilt intertwined like poison and wine.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
vibeBlurb: Sunlit country estates and sparkling conversation. The slow bloom of understanding between two stubborn hearts. Dancing at balls where every glance means everything.

author: George Orwell
vibeBlurb: Grey corridors and watchful eyes. The crushing weight of a world where even your thoughts aren't safe. Love as an act of rebellion against infinite darkness.

title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
vibeBlurb: Sun-warmed skin and sand between your toes. A love so fierce it echoes through millennia. The terrible beauty of fate rushing toward you like waves.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
vibeBlurb: Rainy Tokyo evenings and memories that won't let go. The haunting space between loving and losing. Walking through fog, searching for something you can't name.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
vibeBlurb: Black and white tents appearing at midnight. Magic that tastes like caramel and smells like autumn leaves. A love story written in impossible wonders.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
vibeBlurb: Wind howling across empty moors. A love so consuming it transcends death itself. Passion and cruelty twisted together like heather and thorns.

title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
author: Stephen Chbosky
vibeBlurb: Mixtapes and late-night drives through tunnels. The overwhelming beauty of feeling infinite, even when you're breaking. Finding your people and holding on tight.

title: Rebecca
author: Daphne du Maurier
vibeBlurb: Rhododendrons and sea mist clinging to stone walls. A ghost that lives in every corner, every whisper. The weight of being compared to someone you can never meet.

title: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath
vibeBlurb: Looking at the world through thick glass. The slow suffocation of expectations pressing in from all sides. Sharp, crystalline prose that cuts to the bone.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
vibeBlurb: Crackling fires and handwritten plays. Sisters growing up together, each finding her own way. The cozy warmth of home even when everything changes.

title: The Goldfinch
author: Donna Tartt
vibeBlurb: Dust and grief and a small painting that contains everything. The way trauma follows you through years and cities. Beauty as both salvation and destruction.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
vibeBlurb: Herbs growing wild on a lonely island. Finding power in exile, strength in solitude. The slow, fierce work of becoming yourself against the will of gods.

title: A Little Life
author: Hanya Yanagihara
vibeBlurb: A friendship that spans decades and holds everything. The body's memory of pain that never fully heals. Love as fierce protection against an unforgiving world.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
vibeBlurb: Velvet curtains and poisonous flowers. The seductive danger of eternal youth at any cost. Every beautiful surface hiding something rotting underneath.

title: Beach Read
author: Emily Henry
vibeBlurb: Sandy feet and sunsets on the porch. Two writers challenging each other while falling in love. The hope that comes after heartbreak, unexpected and real.

title: The Haunting of Hill House
author: Shirley Jackson
vibeBlurb: Walls that breathe and doors that open by themselves. The horror of being truly seen by something that shouldn't exist. A house that wants to keep you forever.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
vibeBlurb: A small, plain governess with fire in her soul. Love earned through independence, not submission. Dark hallways and secrets that burn.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
vibeBlurb: Wandering New York City feeling like a stranger everywhere. The ache of wanting to protect innocence you've already lost. Searching for something real in a world of pretenders.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
vibeBlurb: The past that refuses to stay buried. Mother love so fierce it becomes something else entirely. Memory as a haunting you can't escape.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
vibeBlurb: Kites flying over Kabul before everything changed. The weight of childhood betrayal carried across decades. The long road to being good again.

title: East of Eden
author: John Steinbeck
vibeBlurb: Salinas Valley stretching toward the mountains. The old story of good and evil retold through American soil. The power of choice echoing through generations.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
vibeBlurb: All unhappy families, each in their own way. A passion that burns everything it touches. Train stations and snowstorms and the weight of society.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
vibeBlurb: Words stolen in the dark of Nazi Germany. Death as a narrator with a poet's soul. The small rebellions that keep us human.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
vibeBlurb: Feverish St. Petersburg streets and a mind turning against itself. The unbearable weight of guilt. Suffering as the path to redemption.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
vibeBlurb: Humid Alabama summers seen through a child's eyes. The innocence of small-town mysteries and the weight of witnessing injustice. Standing up when it costs everything.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
vibeBlurb: Red robes and downcast eyes in a world that was ours. The daily violence of control disguised as protection. Memory as the last rebellion.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
vibeBlurb: Engineered happiness and conditioning centres. Pleasure without meaning, peace without freedom. The horror of a world where suffering has been abolished along with humanity.

title: Atonement
author: Ian McEwan
vibeBlurb: A hot summer day and a terrible misunderstanding. Lives derailed by a child's imagination. The stories we tell ourselves to live with what we've done.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
vibeBlurb: Patient vengeance served over decades. The prison darkness that forges something new. Justice delivered with devastating precision and theatrical flair.

title: Never Let Me Go
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
vibeBlurb: Boarding school memories with something deeply wrong underneath. The quiet horror of accepting your fate. Love in the shadow of predetermined endings.

title: The Remains of the Day
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
vibeBlurb: The perfect butler in a fading world. All the words never spoken, the feelings never acknowledged. Dignity as both armor and prison.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
vibeBlurb: Lightning and forbidden knowledge. The creature who only wanted to be loved. Playing god and running from the consequences across Arctic ice.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
vibeBlurb: Spice and sandworms and desert messiahs. Power games spanning galaxies. The weight of prophecy you never asked for.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
vibeBlurb: Ash falling like snow on a dead world. A father and son carrying the fire. Love as the last light in absolute darkness.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
vibeBlurb: A town where it rains for years and the dead refuse to leave. Generations circling the same fates. Magic woven so deeply into reality you forget it's strange.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
vibeBlurb: Faith and doubt wrestling in the Russian soul. Three brothers, three ways of being human. Questions too big for answers echoing through cathedral darkness.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
vibeBlurb: Marriage as a hall of mirrors. The mask of the perfect wife and what's rotting underneath. Trust as the first casualty.

title: The Secret Garden
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
vibeBlurb: A hidden door in a Yorkshire wall. Children healing alongside roses and robin songs. The magic of growing things making everything possible.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
vibeBlurb: A legend telling his own story in an empty inn. Music and magic intertwined like lovers. The silence between the songs that matters most.

title: The House of Mirth
author: Edith Wharton
vibeBlurb: A beautiful woman navigating gilded cages. Society's rules written in invisible ink. The slow fall from grace in silk and diamonds.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
vibeBlurb: The sun so bright it overwhelms everything. Feeling nothing when you should feel everything. The absurdity of existence laid bare on hot sand.

title: Call Me by Your Name
author: André Aciman
vibeBlurb: Italian summer heat and stolen glances. The agony of wanting someone so close you can taste it. Orchards and bicycles and a name that means everything.

title: Persuasion
author: Jane Austen
vibeBlurb: Eight years of regret and quiet longing. Autumn by the sea and second chances. A love letter disguised as a novel about patience.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
vibeBlurb: Letters to God from a woman finding her voice. Purple fields and sisterhood that saves. Surviving what should have destroyed you.

title: The Age of Innocence
author: Edith Wharton
vibeBlurb: Opera boxes and unspoken longings. The prison of propriety and the love that exists in glances. A whole life lived in what-ifs.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
vibeBlurb: A boy and a tiger on endless blue ocean. Stories we tell ourselves to survive the unsurvivable. Faith floating on impossible hope.

title: The Virgin Suicides
author: Jeffrey Eugenides
vibeBlurb: Five blonde sisters glimpsed through suburban windows. The mystery you'll never solve, the girls you'll never understand. Adolescence as fever dream.

title: My Year of Rest and Relaxation
author: Ottessa Moshfegh
vibeBlurb: Sleeping through grief in a Manhattan apartment. The year before the towers fell. Numbness as a survival strategy.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
vibeBlurb: Marshes and a rotting wedding cake. A boy learning what makes a gentleman. The chains of gratitude and the freedom of truth.

title: The Waves
author: Virginia Woolf
vibeBlurb: Six voices rising and falling like tides. The self dissolving and reforming across a lifetime. Language as pure feeling.

title: Interview with the Vampire
author: Anne Rice
vibeBlurb: Eternal life as eternal grief. Gas-lit New Orleans and the curse of beauty. The weight of centuries pressing down like velvet.

title: Middlesex
author: Jeffrey Eugenides
vibeBlurb: Three generations of secrets written in DNA. A city burning and identities transforming. The self as an unfolding mystery.

title: The Master and Margarita
author: Mikhail Bulgakov
vibeBlurb: The devil himself strolling through Soviet Moscow. A talking cat and a witch's ball. Art surviving tyranny through magic and madness.

title: On the Road
author: Jack Kerouac
vibeBlurb: Highways unspooling across America like jazz riffs. The mad ones burning, burning, burning. Freedom as motion, meaning as speed.

title: We Need to Talk About Kevin
author: Lionel Shriver
vibeBlurb: Letters to an absent husband about an impossible son. The slow horror of watching someone you made become something terrible. Motherhood as crime scene.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
vibeBlurb: Dust and hunger and the long road West. Families holding together against everything designed to break them. Anger as fuel for survival.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
vibeBlurb: Ancient evil in a crumbling castle. Letters and journal entries mapping encroaching darkness. The seduction of surrender to something beyond death.

title: The Poisonwood Bible
author: Barbara Kingsolver
vibeBlurb: Five voices navigating a world their father sought to conquer. The jungle that swallows missionaries whole. Sisterhood surviving what zealotry destroyed.

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Being
author: Milan Kundera
vibeBlurb: Love and betrayal under Soviet tanks. The weight of choices that can never be remade. Prague spring frozen into permanent winter.

title: White Oleander
author: Janet Fitch
vibeBlurb: Poisonous beauty passed from mother to daughter. Foster homes like way stations through difficult terrain. Survival as the art of becoming someone new.

title: The Shadow of the Wind
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
vibeBlurb: A cemetery of forgotten books in post-war Barcelona. A novel that leads to obsession and danger. Stories as ghosts that refuse to die.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
vibeBlurb: So it goes. Unstuck in time between devastation and alien planets. The absurdity of war told by someone who can't tell it any other way.

title: Pachinko
author: Min Jin Lee
vibeBlurb: Four generations of a Korean family in Japan. History as the game you can't win but keep playing. Survival passed down like precious heirlooms.

title: Less
author: Andrew Sean Greer
vibeBlurb: Running away from a wedding around the entire world. Turning fifty and discovering you haven't ruined everything. Comedy as survival strategy.

title: Shuggie Bain
author: Douglas Stuart
vibeBlurb: A boy who loves his mother more than she can love herself. Council estates and stubborn devotion. The tenderness that survives everything.

title: Their Eyes Were Watching God
author: Zora Neale Hurston
vibeBlurb: A woman finding her voice through three marriages and a hurricane. Pear trees blooming and horizons calling. Language as beautiful as what it describes.

title: The God of Small Things
author: Arundhati Roy
vibeBlurb: Twins circling a terrible secret in Kerala. Love laws broken and paid for dearly. Language dripping like monsoon rains.

title: Ninth House
author: Leigh Bardugo
vibeBlurb: Secret societies and real magic at Yale. Ghosts and privilege and a survivor who sees through both. Dark academia with actual darkness.

title: Flowers for Algernon
author: Daniel Keyes
vibeBlurb: A mind blooming and then fading like flowers. The cruelty of knowing what you're losing. A mouse named Algernon running the maze first.

title: If We Were Villains
author: M.L. Rio
vibeBlurb: Seven Shakespeare students and one of them dead. Life and theater blurring until no one knows which is which. All the world's a stage, especially tragedy.

title: The House of the Spirits
author: Isabel Allende
vibeBlurb: Three generations of women who can move tables with their minds. A country bleeding through revolutions. Spirits and history woven inseparably together.

title: Kafka on the Shore
author: Haruki Murakami
vibeBlurb: A boy running away and an old man who talks to cats. Parallel stories that touch like dreams. The entrance stone to somewhere else.

title: A Court of Thorns and Roses
author: Sarah J. Maas
vibeBlurb: Beauty and the Beast with faeries and thorns. A huntress becoming something powerful and loved. Magic that costs everything and gives it back.

title: The Buried Giant
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
vibeBlurb: An elderly couple crossing a land that forgets. Dragons and memory and what marriage means after decades. The mist that protects us from ourselves.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
vibeBlurb: A shepherd following omens across the desert. The universe conspiring to help you find your treasure. Simplicity as profound wisdom.

title: The Silence of the Lambs
author: Thomas Harris
vibeBlurb: A young agent and a caged monster. Quid pro quo in the basement of a hospital. The screaming that never quite stops.

title: The Lovely Bones
author: Alice Sebold
vibeBlurb: A girl watching her family from heaven. The afterlife as a place of longing. Grief observed from impossibly far away.

title: The Time Traveler's Wife
author: Audrey Niffenegger
vibeBlurb: Love scattered across time like broken glass. Waiting for someone who keeps appearing and disappearing. The future as memory, memory as future.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
vibeBlurb: A girl who raised herself in the Carolina marsh. Nature as mother, teacher, and hiding place. The marsh girl they never understood.

title: The Night Watch
author: Sarah Waters
vibeBlurb: Wartime London told backwards through time. Love and secrets in the blackout. The way endings become beginnings when you reverse the reel.

title: The Vanishing Half
author: Brit Bennett
vibeBlurb: Twin sisters who chose different paths through life. The self you become when you leave yourself behind. Generations of secrets and becoming.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
vibeBlurb: A mountain childhood without schools or doctors. The terrifying freedom of learning to think for yourself. Education as both escape and exile.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
vibeBlurb: A library between life and death full of lives you could have lived. Every regret a book you can step into. The hope hidden in infinite possibilities.

title: Mexican Gothic
author: Silvia Moreno-Garcia
vibeBlurb: A glamorous socialite trapped in a rotting mansion. Mushrooms growing in the walls and in your dreams. Mexican high society meets cosmic horror.

title: Piranesi
author: Susanna Clarke
vibeBlurb: Endless halls filled with statues and tides. A man alone in an impossible house, keeping careful records. Wonder as a form of survival.

title: Station Eleven
author: Emily St. John Mandel
vibeBlurb: A traveling Shakespeare company in the post-pandemic world. Survival is insufficient. The art that saves us when everything else is gone.

title: The Blind Assassin
author: Margaret Atwood
vibeBlurb: A novel within a novel within a memoir. Sisters and secrets across a century. The stories we tell to hide the truth and reveal it.

title: The Secret Life of Bees
author: Sue Monk Kidd
vibeBlurb: Honey and the mothers we find when we need them. A girl searching for the truth about her past. The hum of bees as a kind of prayer.

title: The House in the Cerulean Sea
author: TJ Klune
vibeBlurb: A bureaucrat finding love and family in the strangest places. Magical children who deserve to be protected. The courage to choose a different life.

title: The Starless Sea
author: Erin Morgenstern
vibeBlurb: A secret library beneath the world where stories come alive. Doors that open to everywhere and nowhere. Love letters to the act of reading itself.

title: A Thousand Splendid Suns
author: Khaled Hosseini
vibeBlurb: Two women bound by circumstance and transformed by love. Kabul through decades of war. A thousand splendid suns hidden behind each face.

title: Cloud Atlas
author: David Mitchell
vibeBlurb: Six stories nested like Russian dolls across centuries. Souls echoing through time. The connections we can't see but always feel.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
vibeBlurb: A hobbit who never expected an adventure. Riddles in the dark and a dragon's hoard. The small brave things that change everything.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
vibeBlurb: The smallest person can change the course of the future. Fellowship forged in darkness. The bittersweet victory that comes with loss.

title: The Testaments
author: Margaret Atwood
vibeBlurb: The testimony of those who survived Gilead. Resistance from within and without. The patient work of bringing empires down.

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
vibeBlurb: Ten strangers on an island, dying one by one. Justice served in the most twisted way. The nursery rhyme that becomes a death sentence.

title: The Shadow of the Gods
author: John Gwynne
vibeBlurb: A world where the gods are dead but their power lingers. Viking-inspired warriors and monsters. Ice and blood and the bonds that survive both.

title: The Name of the Rose
author: Umberto Eco
vibeBlurb: A labyrinthine library hiding deadly secrets. Medieval monks and forbidden knowledge. The pursuit of truth in a world that fears it.

title: The Four Winds
author: Kristin Hannah
vibeBlurb: Dust storms that bury everything including hope. A mother's desperate journey westward. The strength it takes to survive when the land turns against you.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
vibeBlurb: A teacher waking up alone in space with humanity's survival at stake. Science as salvation. The unlikely friendship that saves everything.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
vibeBlurb: A woman who shot her husband and never spoke again. A therapist obsessed with unlocking her silence. The truth hiding in plain sight.

title: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue
author: V.E. Schwab
vibeBlurb: A woman cursed to be forgotten by everyone she meets. Three hundred years of invisible existence. The first person who finally remembers her name.
